educational_objective: Diagnose lung cancer with PET/CT scan.
question_text: A 67-year-old woman is evaluated for a lung mass.PET/CT scan is shown.
question_stem: Which of the following is the most likely diagnosis?
critique: The most likely diagnosis is lung cancer (Option B). PET/CT is a standard component of initial staging for all patients with nonâ€“small cell lung cancer and is useful for assessing mediastinal nodes and identifying distant metastatic disease. This patient's PET/CT scan shows enhanced uptake of the 18-fluorodeoxyglucose marker (seen as red on the image), indicating increased metabolic activity consistent with high likelihood of malignancy. Abnormal 18-fluorodeoxyglucose uptake is not seen elsewhere on the scan. Resection of this lesion showed an adenocarcinoma with no evidence of spread to hilar or mediastinal nodes.
